ResourceHeader.Description: Sodium lidar at Tromsoe, Norway, measuring sodium density, temperature, and wind in the mesosphere at altitudes of 80-110km. Details of the instruments is available at Nozawa et al. (2014). The full reference is Nozawa, S., T. D. Kawahara, N. Saito, C. M. Hall, T. T. Tsuda, T. Kawabata, S. Wada, A. Brekke, T. Takahashi, H. Fujiwara, Y. Ogawa, and R. Fujii, Variations of the neutral temperature and sodium density between 80 and 107 km above Tromso during the winter of 2010-2011 by a new solid state sodium LIDAR, J. Geophys. Res., 119, doi:10.1002/2013JA019520, 2014.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please contact the principal investigator (PI) of this observation, Dr. Nozawa (nozawa at isee.nagoya-u.ac.jp) before using the data. The sodium lidar has been operated under collabrations among ISEE, Nagoya University, Shinshu University, RIKEN, EISCAT, and TGO, University of Tromsoe.
